intro: Pellionia vanhasseltii, commonly known as the velvetleaf pellionia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles. Pellionia vanhasseltii thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
